Title: Migrating to TanStack Start
Description:
A while ago, I decided to move away from full-stack React frameworks and use a client-server setup. That is, separate the backend and the frontend, each being a standalone app.

So, here‚Äôs the stack I ended up choosing:

 * Frontend: React

Title: Improving My Dotfiles Posture
Description: An important part of my design philosophy for software scalability is minimizing machine-to-machine differences wherever possible. This allows me to focus more on what I‚Äôm delivering rather than where, with any changes to common pieces benefitting all downstream machines. By worrying less about each machine being a unicorn, I have more mental bandwidth for the functional parts of the system, which is where I‚Äôd rather spend my time. And, running the same software on every machine possible maximizes the testing of it, contributing to higher-quality software.

Title: Unaccountable systems
Description:
My mum visited not long ago. I paid for her flight and a few other expenses and
she refunded me for that in US dollars in cash. I needed to convert these into

Travelex‚Äù, to exchange these dollars into Euros.

Title: skiftOS
Description: skiftOS is a hobby operating system built for learning and for fun targeting the x86 platform. It features a kernel named hjert, a graphical user interface with a compositing window manager, and familiar UNIX utilities.
